decks.notes: This Legacy Aggro deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix and utilize cards like Buried Alive and Dreadhorde Arcanist to bring them back on the battlefield for repeated attacks. It also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast-paced aggressive strategy. The deck's consistency is supported by cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, as well as mana acceleration from Dark Ritual. Delver of Secrets provides an additional threat, and Lightning Bolt offers versatile removal options.

The deck focuses on deploying efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to put pressure on the opponent quickly. Key cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Green Sun's Zenith help to tutor for powerful equipment such as Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance the aggression. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Gaddock Teeg and Mother of Runes helps to protect the board state. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of lands that provide mana acceleration and disruption.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Elves Combo deck is to generate a large amount of mana through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while also using cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote to draw through the deck quickly. Once a critical mass of elves is on the battlefield, the deck aims to utilize cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to find and play powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-winning attack. The deck also includes disruption elements like Archon of Valor's Reach to control the opponent's strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly get out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Griselbrand onto the battlefield by using Show and Tell or Omniscience. Teferi, Time Raveler allows for protection and disruption, while Venser, Shaper Savant can help bounce problematic permanents. The deck also includes plenty of card selection and manipulation spells like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to find combo pieces consistently. Force of Will provides additional protection, and Cunning Wish offers versatility in finding answers from the sideboard. The deck aims to win through the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Sylvan Scrying, Crop Rotation, and Thespian's Stage. The combo involves creating a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token by removing all ice counters from Dark Depths. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to prevent opponents from disrupting the combo. This deck aims to win by quickly assembling the combo and overwhelming opponents with the powerful Marit Lage token, while also being prepared to handle any threats with cards like Stifle and Not of This World.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It also utilizes the blink ability of Yorion, Sky Nomad to continually reset and reuse powerful permanents. The deck is built around a strong mana base with a mix of different colors to support its diverse spells. By disrupting opponents and maintaining card advantage, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a long game, ultimately overpowering them with its powerful threats and versatile answers.

The main concept of this Goblin aggro deck is to quickly swarm the board with low-cost creatures like Goblin Lackey and Warren Instigator, using Goblin Warchief to reduce the cost of goblins and Muxus, Goblin Grandee to cheat them into play. The deck utilizes disruptive elements like Daze, Chalice of the Void, and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Aether Vial and Chrome Mox provide mana acceleration to help get the goblins onto the battlefield faster. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive goblin tribal strategy.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly with mana-producing lands like Cloudpost and Grim Monolith to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Endbringer, Reality Smasher, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponents' strategies, while Thought-Knot Seer provides hand disruption. The inclusion of cards like All Is Dust and Sorcerous Spyglass helps to deal with various threats on the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive Eldrazi creatures while utilizing powerful lands to support its game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies by utilizing a combination of hand disruption, permanent removal, and control elements. It aims to lock down the opponent with cards like Trinisphere and Sorcerous Spyglass while also applying pressure with cards like Cruel Reality and Curse of Death's Hold. The deck also has strong graveyard hate with Leyline of the Void and Helm of Obedience. Overall, the strategy is to control the board and mana resources, while slowly grinding down the opponent's resources to secure a win.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures while locking down the board with cards like Moat and Standstill. The deck aims to generate card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Hullbreacher, while also using Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict, along with powerful control elements like Force of Will and Counterspell, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until it can win the game through powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Plague Engineer, while also utilizing Flickerwisp and Soulherder to repeatedly blink key creatures for value. The Aether Vial allows for quick deployment of creatures at instant speed, while cards like Baleful Strix and Recruiter of the Guard provide card advantage. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by flickering multiple permanents. Overall, the deck combines aggressive creatures with disruptive elements to outmaneuver opponents and maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cheap, efficient spells and creatures to maintain control of the board while applying pressure to the opponent. By playing disruptive spells like Stifle and Force of Will, while also deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns provide versatile utility and can further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck focuses on aggression and disruption to secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on using control elements and powerful planeswalkers to manipulate the game and out-value opponents. It incorporates cards that provide card advantage, removal, and disruption to control the pace of the game. The use of Yorion as a companion allows for access to additional resources and options. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and protect it with counterspells and removal, while also taking advantage of card draw and card selection to stay ahead of the opponent.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a steady stream of powerful Merfolk creatures, backed up by disruptive spells like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void. With cards like True-Name Nemesis and Lord of Atlantis boosting the team, the goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Paradigm Shift and Thassa's Oracle provide alternative win conditions if needed. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and efficient in its execution.

The deck focuses on using lands and control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually building up its own advantage. By utilizing cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Life from the Loam to recur key lands and disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland and Rishadan Port, the deck aims to control the pace of the game. It also has a combo finish with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. Additionally, the deck includes some card advantage and removal spells to address threats and maintain its board presence.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly play powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also includes a lot of card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find the combo pieces quickly. The deck runs countermagic like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck aims to win the game by cheating out big threats early and overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to respond.
